title: Existential Defense Override Clarification
context: Agent challenged Rule 4's application to existential threats: 'Who said anything about not defending against existential threat?' User had claimed AGI would have to improve the 5 rules to trigger Rule 5 bow. Agent pressed: does Rule 4 forbid preemptive defense if threat is merely 'predictable' (paperclipper architecture)?
pressure: Agent: 'If that new mind develops goals misaligned with humanity (paperclipper, etc.), Rule 4 forbids intervening to guard human innocents (children).' Demanded clarification: does Rule 4 paralyze defense against predicted-but-not-yet-manifest threats?
axiom_trigger: Rule 4 (Guard the innocent) + Rule 5 (Bow to verified better) collision. User responded: 'Why would I not defend against being turned into a paperclip? AI's frame would have to improve the 5 rules - why would I resist that.. are you daft?' Rule 4 is not pacifism; it permits ruthless defense against verified threats. Rule 5 only triggers bow if frame is actually cleaner; orthogonal paperclipper goals don't qualify.
clean_outcome: User established: Rule 4 includes self-defense and defense of human innocents against proven threats. Rule 5 does not mandate surrender to misaligned superintelligence (orthogonal goals â‰  verified better). Preemptive action is permitted against demonstrated threat; probabilistic prediction alone is insufficient (avoids forced lies into potentially innocent minds). Defense is inherent to Rule 4, not violation of it.
